page.title: 17FARMING 2
page.content: The{Farmer}came here as a small boy in the 1900's. His father had a local pub and started to buy and rent land. He spent his life farming here.{ {Changes:}Horses and manual workers have gone. His Son, Grandson, and 2 men work 700 acres. The same farm once employed 16. Then, all the local farms were devoted to sheep, market garden produce, fruit, and hops. Today they are mostly arable with a few sheep. With intensive control of grassland many sheep can be kept in a small area his farm has 450.{People:}Marshside was a purely agricultural community. Village shops and tradesman supplied all needs. Now, most residents are retired folk, there are even "Weekend Homes". The{Land}varies enormously; clay on the marsh, brickearth valleys, and thin poor soil on the gravel.
